title: New Ribble Allroad bikes are aero-optimised and offer up to 38mm tyre clearance
content:
Cyclist
New Ribble Allroad bikes are aero-optimised and offer up to 38mm tyre clearance

Ribble has launched a new range of Allroad SL carbon bikes, headlined by the Allroad SL R, which includes aero features and offers 38mm tyre clearance.

Prices start at £2,999 and Ribble claims a 7.5kg weight for the top spec £8,299 Hero build in size M, equipped with Shimano Dura-Ace and Zipp 353 NSW wheels. 

The Ribble Allroad SL offers a more affordable option. Its frame is based on the Endurance SL and is slightly less aero-optimised with a little less tyre clearance at 35mm. It’s available in stock builds with prices starting at £1,699. The highest-spec £2,999 Pro build has an 8.8kg claimed weight and is equipped with Shimano 105 Di2 and Mavic Cosmic S carbon wheels.

Finally, there’s an electric opinion, the Ribble Allroad SL R e. It’s powered by the lightweight Mahle eBikemotion X20 drive system and has a claimed weight as low as 11.8kg and a range of up to 140km. Prices start at £3,999 and head up to £8,499 for the Hero build.

As usual, Ribble offers online spec configuration and custom colour options across the range, with over a million colour combinations possible.

Road+ bike range

Ribble describes the Allroad as a road+ bike. It’s designed to be efficient and comfortable when ridden on tarmac, but with the capability to handle off-road excursions. The tyre clearance drops to a still-considerable 35mm if you fit mudguards on the hidden mounts and Ribble delivers a rack converter, so that you can fit the Allroad for load-lugging should you wish.

Many of the Allroad SL R’s features are developed from the Ribble Ultra Road aero road race bike. That includes the aero tube profiles and seatpost, with a waisted head tube and a wider bulge in the down tube, similar to that of the Pinarello Dogma F, which improves aerodynamics around the bottle cages.

The Allroad SL R and SL R e are fitted with the Ultra Bar Second Generation (UB2) handlebars, which incorporate the same patented airflow-tripping wake generator design as the Ultra’s. A separate bar and stem, rather than the Ultra’s one-piece design, ensure adjustability and there’s full internal cable routing.

While the Ultra bar can be used without bar tape, Ribble will tape the bars on all of its bikes when sold. Bar widths increase from 34/38cm up to 40/44cm. For both pairs of figures, the former is for the tops, the latter for the drops; as with modern bikes like the Trek Madone the bars flare significantly, putting you in a more aero position on the tops but adding control when in the drops. Ribble’s bike builder allows you to spec narrower bars if you’re looking for extra aero benefits.

At the same time, Ribble has relaxed the Allroad’s geometry, saying that this makes it comfortable for all-day riding and for taking on mixed terrain. The Allroad SL R and SL R e use a mix of high spec Toray T1000 and M46 carbon fibre, similar to that used in premium bikes such as the new Wilier Verticale, helping to lower the frame weight. 

In the SL R, there’s also down tube internal frame storage. This is becoming a popular addition to more endurance-focussed road bikes including the Canyon Endurace and also in many of the best gravel bikes. Ribble has worked with Restrap to develop the integrated Rifft tool kit, which can be ordered with the tools to fix many roadside problems, including a tubeless repair kit and even a mini pump.

You can fit Ribble’s aero-optimised bottle cages, which abut the frame along their length for better aerodynamics and are shielded from the airflow by the broadened down tube, offering extra free speed over riding the bike without bottles and cages.

Successor to the Endurance SL

While the Allroad SL R’s design is derived from the Ultra SL R, the Allroad SL is based more on the Endurance SL. The frame is made using a mix of T800 and T700 carbon fibre, the same as included in the Endurance SL. There’s a more standard round two-piece bar and stem, external cable routing and round seatpost.

Ribble has added the full range of frame mounts to the Allroad SL too, including hidden mudguard mounts and the option to fit a rack.

Electric option

Ribble has been a keen adopter of the Mahle eBikemotion electric motor system, with a number of bikes available with its rear hub motor.

The Ribble Allroad SL R e incorporates the newer X20 system from Mahle. This has a more compact motor with greater torque of 55Nm than the older X35 system and includes a torque sensor for improved power management. 

The fully integrated down tube battery has increased in capacity to 350Wh from the Endurance SL e‘s 250Wh, providing a 140km claimed range. There’s also the option to add an external range extender to power the bike for over 200km. 

Mahle’s app provides a range of ride-tuning functionality, as well as route planning and the option to regulate power output based on your heart rate, as used by Sean Yates on his Ribble Endurance SL e.

  • Find out more about the Allroad SL R e on cyclingelectric.com

Specs and prices

Ribble will sell the Allroad in a range of pre-configured specs, but also gives you the option to customise your build. All specs except the Allroad SL Sport with Tiagra are fitted with a 50/34t compact crankset with an 11-36 tooth cassette.

Ribble Allroad SL R pre-built specs

Allroad SL R – Sport

  • Frame: Allroad SL R Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano 105 2×12-Speed Mechanical
  • Handlebars: Level Alloy
  • Wheels: Mavic Aksium 1 Disc
  • Base price: From £2,999

Allroad SL R – Enthusiast

  • Frame: Allroad SL R Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano 105 Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Handlebars: Level Alloy
  • Wheels: Mavic Aksium 1 Disc
  • Base price: From £3,999

Allroad SL R – Pro

  • Frame: Allroad SL R Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano Ultegra Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Handlebars: Ribble UB2 Carbon
  • Wheels: Mavic Cosmic S 42 Carbon
  • Base price: From £4,999

Allroad SL R – Hero

  • Frame: Allroad SL R Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Handlebars: Ribble UB2 Carbon
  • Wheels: Zipp 353 NSW Carbon Disc
  • Base price: From £8,299

Ribble Allroad SL pre-built specs

Allroad SL – Sport

  • Frame: Allroad SL Carbon Fibre
  • Groupset: Shimano Tiagra 2×10-Speed
  • Wheels: Mavic Aksium 1 Disc
  • Base price: From £1,699

Allroad SL – Enthusiast

  • Frame: Allroad SL Carbon Fibre
  • Groupset: Shimano 105 2×12-Speed Mechanical
  • Wheels: Mavic Aksium 1 Disc
  • Base price: From £1,999

Allroad SL – Pro

  • Frame: Allroad SL Carbon Fibre
  • Groupset: Shimano 105 Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Wheels: Mavic Cosmic S 42 Carbon
  • Base price: From £2,999

Ribble Allroad SL R e pre-built specs

Allroad SL R e – Sport

  • Frame: Allroad SL R e Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano 105 2×12-Speed Mechanical
  • Handlebars: Level Alloy
  • Wheels: Mavic Allroad Disc Wheels
  • Base price: From £3,999

Allroad SL R e – Enthusiast

  • Frame: Allroad SL R e Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano 105 Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Handlebars: Level Alloy
  • Wheels: Mavic Allroad Disc
  • Base price: From £4,599

Allroad SL R e – Pro

  • Frame: Allroad SL R e Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano Ultegra Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Handlebars: Ribble UB2 Carbon
  • Wheels: Mavic Cosmic SL 45 Carbon
  • Base price: From £5,999

Allroad SL R e – Hero

  • Frame: Allroad SL R e Carbon Monocoque
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 2×12-Speed
  • Handlebars: Ribble UB2 Carbon
  • Wheels: Mavic Cosmic SL 45 Carbon
  • Base price: From £8,499
